DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Viable Cell Specimen Outcome Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the viable cell specimen laboratory procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Viable Cell Specimen Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body to determine the viability, capable of life or normal growth and development, of the cells, the smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, from a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Capable of life or normal growth and development.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Capable of life or normal growth and development.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
